title: Low pressure receptors
text:
Low pressure baroreceptors are <a href="baroreceptor">baroreceptor</a>s located in large <a href="Systemic%20venous%20system">systemic veins</a> and in the walls of the <a href="Atrium%20%28heart%29">atria</a> of the <a href="heart">heart</a>. They are also called volume receptors and cardiopulmonary baroreceptors.
Structure.
Low pressure baroreceptors are located in large <a href="Systemic%20venous%20system">systemic veins</a> and the <a href="Atrium%20%28heart%29">atria</a> of the <a href="heart">heart</a>. In the <a href="right%20atrium">right atrium</a>, the stretch receptors occur at the junction of the <a href="venae%20cavae">venae cavae</a>. In the <a href="left%20atrium">left atrium</a>, the junction is at the <a href="Pulmonary%20vein">pulmonary veins</a>.
Function.
Low pressure baroreceptors respond to changes in the wall tension, which is proportional to the filling state of the low pressure side of circulation (below 60 <a href="Millimetre%20of%20mercury">mmHg</a>). Thus, low pressure baroreceptors are involved with the regulation of <a href="blood%20volume">blood volume</a>. The blood volume determines the <a href="mean%20systemic%20pressure">mean systemic pressure</a> throughout the system, in particular in the venous side where most of the blood is held. Increasing stretch of the receptors stimulates both an increase in heart rate and a decrease in <a href="vasopressin">vasopressin</a> (<a href="Vasopressin">ADH</a>) secretion from <a href="posterior%20pituitary">posterior pituitary</a>, and <a href="renin">renin</a> and <a href="aldosterone">aldosterone</a>. The decrease in <a href="vasopressin">vasopressin</a> secretion results in an increase in the volume of <a href="urine">urine</a> <a href="Excretion">excreted</a>, serving to lower blood pressure.
In addition, stretching of atrial receptors increases secretion of <a href="atrial%20natriuretic%20peptide">atrial natriuretic peptide</a> (ANP), which promotes increased water and sodium <a href="excretion">excretion</a> through the <a href="urine">urine</a>.
